title: Lyndon B Johnson National Historical Park: Partners
body: Explore This Park    Get Involved     Partners             Partners       Friends of Lyndon B. Johnson National Historical Park          The Friends of LBJ National Historical Park was founded in 2007 with encouragement from the President's daughters, Luci Johnson and Lynda Johnson Robb. The Friends provide on-going support for park programs, restoration efforts, recreational events, and opportunities to learn about the life of the President, his family and friends, and the national and world leaders who visited the LBJ Ranch throughout the 1960s.      Western National Parks Association           As a nonprofit education partner of the National Park Service, Western National Parks Association supports 67 parks across the western United States, developing products, services, and programs that enrich the visitor experience. WNPA is best known for its Park Stores within the national parks. All proceeds are returned to the parks to support visitor programs and educational activities.
